content.title: Fodder Minikits under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP) Scheme (ST Category)
content.department: Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat
content.details: The scheme 'Fodder Minikits under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP) Scheme' is implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat. Under this scheme, improved varieties of fodder seeds are provided to beneficiaries for widespread publicity, demonstration and adaptation by farmers.
benefits: Under this scheme, the fodder seed minikit of 3 Kg, 7 Kg or 10 Kg is given to the eligible beneficiary.
eligibility: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat.
The beneficiary of the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category can avail the benefit under this scheme.
The beneficiary should possess 10 Guntha of land to his or her name.
content.application_process: To avail the benefits of the scheme, the beneficiary may contact a nearby Veterinary Dispensary or First Aid Veterinary Centre.
documents_required: Proof of possessing 10 Guntha of land

faqs.question: Who implements this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare, and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible beneficiaries receive fodder seed minikits of 3 Kg, 7 Kg, or 10 Kg.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of Gujarat, particularly those belonging to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category, are eligible.

faqs.question: Are there any land ownership requirements for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, the beneficiary should possess at least 10 Guntha of land in their name.

faqs.question: How can I avail myself of this scheme?
faqs.answer: You can avail the benefits by contacting a nearby Veterinary dispensary or First Aid Veterinary Centre.

faqs.question: Are there any specific types of fodder seeds provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, improved varieties of fodder seeds are provided to beneficiaries.
